FileListBoxArray Class

In this Article

Provides a control array of FileListBox controls.

public class FileListBoxArray : Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray, System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider

Remarks

The FileListBox class provides an equivalent for the run-time functionality of a Visual Basic 6.0 FileListBox array. It does not provide the design-time features of a Visual Basic 6.0 control array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Properties

  • Item(Int16)

    Gets a specific element of a FileListBoxArray by index. Read-only.

    public Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.FileListBox this[short Index] { get; }

    Parameters

    • Index
      Int16

      A Short that specifies the position of an element of the control array.

    Property Value

    • FileListBox

      A stem.Windows.Forms.FileListBox at the specified Index in the control array.

    Remarks

    The Item property is the default property for a control array. Therefore, the following lines of code are equivalent. 

    MsgBox(CStr(FileListBoxArray.Item(1).Text))  
MsgBox(CStr(FileListBoxArray(1).Text))

  • Enter

    Occurs when the control is entered.

    public event EventHandler Enter;

    Remarks

    When you change the focus by using the keyboard (TAB, SHIFT+TAB, and so on), or by calling the Select or SelectNextControl method, focus events occur in the following order:

    Enter

    GotFocus Leave LostFocus

    When you change the focus by using the mouse or by calling the Focus method, focus events occur in the following order:

    Enter

    GotFocus LostFocus Leave

    For more information about how to handle events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

  • Layout

    Occurs when a control should reposition its child controls.

    public event System.Windows.Forms.LayoutEventHandler Layout;

    Remarks

    The Layout event occurs when child controls are added or removed, when the bounds of the control changes, and when other changes occur that can affect the layout of the control. The layout event can be suppressed by using the SuspendLayout and ResumeLayout methods. Suspending layout enables you to perform multiple actions on a control without having to perform a layout for each change.
